info.title: VA Letter Generator API
info.description:
The VA Letter Generator API lets Veterans and their eligible dependents
generate and download official VA letters with watermarks and logos.
Veterans and their dependents may only generate and download letters
for which they are eligible. The letters will be populated with the
Veteran's or eligible dependent's address, Veteran service details,
and the Veteran’s or dependent’s benefits information when returned.

The letters that can be returned to a
Veteran or dependent based on their eligibility are:

* Service verification
* Commissary access (including short term access)
* Benefit verification
* Proof of service
* Medicare Part D
* Minimum essential coverage
* Civil service
* VA benefit summary and award
* VA benefit summary and award for dependents

## Technical overview
The VA Letter Generator API uses a Veteran’s or dependent’s ICN to
determine what letters they are eligible for and then generates
those letters.
When using this API, keep in mind that:

*  Letters generated are not retained by VA. If the Veteran or a
dependent needs a replacement letter or if their eligibility changes,
they will need to generate a new letter.
* Newly generated letters may differ from previously generated ones
because this API returns only the most up-to-date information about
a Veteran and their dependents.
* If the Veteran or eligible dependent needs to update their address,
they may do so through their [VA Profile](https://www.va.gov/sign-in/?oauth=false).
Updates are immediately available for this API.
* Users having trouble downloading letters generated from this API should
download the most recent version of Adobe Acrobat.
* If a va_eauth_service_transaction_id was sent, the header of all API
responses (including error messages) will include it.

### Authentication and Authorization
The authentication model for the VA Letter Generator API is based
on OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect and supports
[client credentials grant](https://developer.va.gov/explore/authorization/docs/client-credentials?api=va_letter_generator).

**Important**: To get production access using client credentials grant, you
must either work for VA or have specific VA agreements in place. If
you have questions, [contact us](https://developer.va.gov/support/contact-us).

### Test data

Use [test data](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/vets-api-clients/blob/master/test_accounts/letter_generator_test_accounts.md)
to validate your application's integration with our API in the sandbox
environment. Sandbox test data contains no PII or PHI but mimics
Veterans’ and dependents’ addresses and benefits information.

get.summary: Returns a list of letters that a Veteran or a dependent is eligible for.
get.description:
The endpoint also returns the specific data that will be populated
  within each eligible letter. This includes, if relevant:


  * Veteran's or dependent’s address
  * Veteran service details
  * Benefits information the Veteran or dependent is eligible for
  * Survivor benefits awarded

  If the API is able to determine eligibility for some but not all letters because
  a partner is down, the list of letters for which a Veteran or dependent is
  determined to be eligible will be returned, along with a
  "letterGeneration.letterEligibilityError” message.

200.description: A Response which indicates a successful Request. The Response may contain "messages" that could describe warnings or further information.

get.summary: Generates JSON-formatted letter content by letter type.
get.description:
Returns the descriptions and content of letters a Veteran or dependent is eligible for in JSON format. | If the GET /eligible-letters endpoint returns | Generate the letter contents with these query parameters | | --- | --- | | hasServiceConnectedDisabilities | serviceConnectedDisabilities | | serviceConnectedPercentage | serviceConnectedEvaluation | | hasNonServiceConnectedPension | nonServiceConnectedPension | | monthlyAwardAmount
And
awardEffectiveDate | monthlyAward | | hasIndividualUnemployabilityGranted | unemployable | | hasSpecialMonthlyCompensation | specialMonthlyCompensation | | hasAdaptedHousing | adaptedHousing | | hasChapter35Eligibility | chapter35Eligibility | | hasDeathResultOfDisability | deathResultOfDisability | | hasSurvivorsPensionAward | survivorsAward |
